New Records: Moldova scored two goals in the first half, including a penalty, to win 2-0 against Malta in their UEFA Nations League match on 2024-09-07.
Key Match Events: Moldova's two goals, one from a penalty, were scored in the first half of the match against Malta.
Pre-Game Insights: Moldova started aggressively, pushing Malta into their own half, particularly in the first half. Malta's lineup included several young players due to injury absences, including Teddy Teuma and Kemar Reid.
Post-Match Reflections: Malta made several substitutions, including replacing Yannick Yankam and Kemar Reid with Carlo Zammit Lonardelli and Luke Montebello during the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was refereed by Mykola Balakin with assistant referees Oleksandr Berkut and Dmytro Zaporozhenko. The game was played at the Stadionul Zimbru in Chisinau.
Others: The article provided detailed lineups for both teams, including key players and substitutions.
